column4: i have a problem with optical audio on my asus at3n7a-i mobo, i upgraded alsa to 1.0.21 and it still says no optical data on my logitech receiver, and there's no red light from the cable.. analogue audio works tho, any ideas? running ubuntu 9.04
http://www.mail-archive.com/pulseaudio-discuss@mail.0pointer.de/msg03215.html
https://launchpad.net/bugs/236372
seems like the same issue, iirc pa and alsa use pretty much the same way of detecting hardware
my bad I linked the wrong launchpad bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/pulseaudio/+bug/353807
i do however get some output refering to iec958 audio
basically the bug is that the driver is treating your Optical audio port as a microphone
was there a bugfix?

if its indeed the same issue, which it sounds like it may be; pastebin what you were going to pastebin and it may end up being something different, I didnt see a bugfix from what I read earlier when I was trying to help corecode
http://pastebin.ca/1737360
iec958 according to google is a digital output port for your card
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/441746
thats your issue
ok, thx for your help, was there a fix to it? havent read it thru yet
yes alsamixer, unmute master and unmute your optical audio out in alsamixer
http://imagebin.org/78229
the far right side there is a muted S/pdif port, and theres also the potential that its on another "sound card" you can cycle through those with F6 if there is one for that audio control
only have default / nvidia / enter device name
how can i unmute it?
press M with it highlighted
anytime
